note.p: Death: Green Street, Grosvenor Square, London (06 March 1858)
Education: Apprenticed to Sir Astley Cooper (FRS 1802); Edinburgh

Career: Lecturer on Anatomy, Guy's Hospital, London; Surgeon, London Infirmary for Diseases of the Eye (1810); Surgeon, St Thomas's Hospital, London (1815-1841); lived in Sir Astley Cooper's house in Old Broad Street and built up a lucrative practice; Surgeon Extraordinary to Queen Victoria; died of heart disease
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1857-1859 vol 9 pp 551-555
